# Welcome {.unnumbered}

This is a the website for ETF2121/5912 Handbook (1e). The handbook is a comprehensive guide to the ETF2121/5912 course, covering the course content and resources. The handbook is designed to be a valuable resource for students, providing them with the information they need to succeed in the course.
In this book, you will find a practicum of skills for data analysis, including data manipulation, data visualization, and data modeling. The book is designed to be a practical guide, with hands-on exercises and examples to help you learn the skills you need to succeed in the course. The book is also designed to be a reference guide, with clear explanations and examples of the key concepts and techniques used in data analysis.
The book is organized into chapters, each covering a specific topic in data analysis. Each chapter includes a summary of the key concepts, hands-on exercises, and examples to help you learn the material. The book also includes a glossary of key terms and concepts, as well as a list of additional resources for further reading.
The book is designed to be used in conjunction with the ETF2121/5912 course, but it can also be used as a standalone resource for anyone interested in learning about data analysis. The book is suitable for students, professionals, and anyone interested in learning about data analysis and its applications.
This book is solely authored by Dr. Joan Tan and is affiliated with Monash University.
